page.title: 12The Fire Service
page.content: {FIRE STATION. The Fire Station was built in 1967 and before that it operated from behind the County Hotel.There are 75 firemen at{Immingham}on 4 different shifts and they have 5 fire appliances.The types of fire they attend are road,home and factory.The biggest fire they have attended was a factory fire at {Flixborough.}The fire station has 8 {gas}suits worth Â£700 each,a body heat reactive camera worth Â£7,000 and the newest fire vehicle cost well over Â£40,000.The fire station is very big and it includes several recreation rooms,a hose repair and drying room,a dormitory for the night shift workers,a fire safety consultancy office and a kitchen with adjoining dining room. {(Written and researched by Emma bundy {and Lauren Poultney.)
